item.title: Tracking Septic Patients in a Hospital
item.description: Background A hospital may be defined as a place, or building, or set of facilities where patients go to receive the care they need. In ancient times, a hospital was not much more than a hotel for the poor, where they could stay and be cared for. Some centuries passed, and now we call hospitals to extremely complex structures, from both physical and functional perspectives. In this context, patients usually undergo a wide variety of diagnostic and/or therapeutic procedures.
